Description: One object that looked a bit like a star at first. It then split into about half a dozen lights, before cloud crossed over them.
Two objects. The first was triangular in shape and had three orange lights. The second was a bright white light.
650-700 objects - appearance of clusters of stars. White and very bright. Arc from horizon to horizon, East to West.
Object was a tri-angle shape, like an inverted ice cream cone. The object disappeared down a country lane.
Elliptical and bright like a star. Movement within object. Moving slowly.
It initially looked like a star. Looked like it was going to crash into the witness's house. Was a green colour, with red on the side.
One object, with a blue glow, which then turned green. It broke up and left smoke. It seemed very large.
Object, burning up in the sky, breaking into two-three pieces, looked like a shooting star, but lower in sky. Turned green.
Orange ball in the sky, looked to be on fire. Was coming from an Easterly direction.
The object looked like a rocket. Had a white/orange glow.
Large blue, fluorescent, cigar shaped object. The object hovered and then moved away quickly.
Bright ball one end, about the size of a tennis ball, which was lit up. Behind it, a long tail tapered off with a smaller ball at the end of the object.
White ball of light. Was moving from West to East. Stopped and then went up into the sky vertically.
One, main object which was very bright. White in colour. Stationary
A huge fireball streaking across the skies of West Yorkshire.
Very bright, like a shooting star. Tri-angle shaped. Flashing lights - red, purple and green. Moving in a Southerly direction.
Looked like very bright stars. They were still, and then moved from side to side.
Two objects with white lights. The second object seemed dimmer. Moving at 90 degree angles. They moved at high speed.
Explosion in the sky, but with no sound. It looked like a rocket. Was very large and had a blue and red light.
A white ball, followed by a USAF jet that was contrail ling. Was moving at high speed in a straight line.
A ball shaped object. It gave off a glow, like a hot coal ember - orange/red. It dropped through the air and then shot up and disappeared.
One large object, the size of an eagle. It looked like three circles joined together. Was dark brown and black. Quite fast.
One, small, balloon shaped object. Brown in colour. Was moving up and down and sideways.
A dark, possibly circular object, as it looked like a rocket at first glance. Part of the object was metallic and glistened.
A red flash fell from the sky. It was falling to the ground in a wide spiral.
A spaceship was seen that had lights on the top and bottom of it.
Mentioned that the planets are in danger from different things going on in our solar system.
Tennis ball size and shape, with an orange centre and a black inner line around the circle. Two bright green flare trails from the rear.
Two grey plumes of smoke in the sky over Stockport Railway Station. A grey triangle was then witnessed.
Red light moving fast, high up in the sky. It slowed down, got fast again and then wobbled from side to side.
The object looked like a rounded triangle, longer at one point, with a giant light in the centre.
Two round, thirty foot objects. Each had one white light on the left, and one red light on the right. Was a low rumbling sound.
Eight to nine lights that looked like they were close and then they separated. Not too bright. Were like large fireworks.
Twenty silver balls with an orange tinge were seen flying West of Enfield Wash.
An object was seen floating up and down and the sun was shining off of it. Also, there were two black dots moving quickly.
Strange red and white lights seen through curtains. Then there was a solid red beam outside the window for about five to ten seconds.
Looked like a shooting star. Had four lights on each side, like a black shadow.
Dark, black torpedo shaped object. White plume of smoke.
Bright oval shape cluster of lights, that grew brighter than the moon.
Object, not a plane, not on flight path and not a star.
One craft with three yellow lights on portside and three red lights on starboard side. Shape was between circular and triangular or Delta wing size.
Huge white ball that was glowing. (Looked like a flying jellyfish).
White cylindrical object moving very fast up into the sky.
Silver object as bright as a star, changed from a cylinder to a crescent moon shape, with red and silver stripes.
Very big red light balls hovering. One red light hung smaller and then dropped out.
A doughnut shaped object was spotted moving from left to right, side to side. One side was shiny and reflective, and the other black.
A star shaped object. Witness watched for a few minutes, then it dropped from the sky like a bomb.
Roundish, football shaped. Flashing lights-multi coloured. The lights were on top, then moved around the object.
The object was spinning whilst stationary, while above a house.
A red unidentified flying object, definitely not an aeroplane.
Saw an unusual object, falling from a cloud, like it was burning, and was very fast. Was viewed for five minutes.
Yellow light in a circular formation. The flash shot across the sky and the lights went out.
Large ball of light. Looked like a rocket. No sound generally, but at times, a slight whirring sound.
Saw the object at 17:30 Sri Lankan time. The object looked like a ring doughnut and was orange and had other rings of colour surrounding it too.
Four bright lights, plus the outer circle of the round object, had eight lights going round in a clockwise direction.
The object was black and silver, and of cylindrical shape and was flying below cloud level.
A black 'UFO' was seen flying over a Methodist Church.
Ball of flames with a solid underneath, the flames went out and came on again, and then plummeted to earth.
The object was a black cylinder rectangle shape and was the size of a house. One minute the colour was black and then changed to a silver colour.
The object was about 2-3mm wide with a domed top and bottom. Was metallic in appearance.
The object was a bright light at first and then looked like a box kite. There was no sound, wings or fuselage.
Two silvery objects, they were pulling apart and moving together and they left vapour trails as they were moving.
Large flash of light which turned into a grey object descending over Cardiff bay, with trailing smoke behind it.
The object looked like a great bright light and was really intense, like a big ball of fire, rapidly moving towards the ground.
The object was a round sphere like the moon and it had green and red flashing lights and was very noisy.
A 'swishing' sound, like a firework was heard and there was a bright green light travelling from East to West. It had a white trail.
The object was missile shaped. Was turquoise in colour, metallic and looked reflective, and was the length of an estate car.
Zoom of light which streaked across the sky from left to right, changed into a silver ball, then a flying saucer shape, before disappearing.
A triangular shaped, huge craft, with red lights on the stern. It hovered over the southern suburbs of Shrewsbury.
There were two objects above the house and they circled above it about five times.
Round, football shaped object that was shiny and metalic.
There were eight to ten circular things/objects that looked quite low in the sky. They were uniform shape, small and opaque.
A bright object was travelling at high speed, horizontally, West to East. The object was a matt white, which looked like marble.
The witness saw a cylindrical shaped object, that changed from silver to black as it was moving across the sky. About 100ft wide.
Two orange orbs seen outside moving very slow at first, then very fast towards the North Sea.
There was a three dimensional diamond shaped object, approx. size of a large helicopter. It had green lights on either side.
There was one light in the sky that burst into four separate ones, before disappearing.
Three glowing lights. They were a bright orange colour.
The object looked like a red ball and was the size of a sixpence. It exploded and the whole sky lit up.
Was travelling to Whitby on the A171, and saw the object that looked like an orange ball.
The trail of light was almost luminous green in colour, and looked like a rocket. Was high in the sky and was travelling at an amazing speed.
An object was moving across the sky and looked like it was on fire. It was cigar shaped and silver in colour.
Four golden spheres. They drifted - South to North East. The witness said they are definitely solid guided craft.
Looked like a satellite coming into the atmosphere and coming to it's end, but then another object came into view and they started zig-zagging about.
There was the mother ship and two smaller orbs that were moving around it. One of the orbs was white in colour and the other orange.
The mother ship was seen again. (The two separate sightings were on one letter).
Eight yellow/orange spheres that looked like they had flames coming out of the back of them.
A triangular object with lights. One green, one red and the other two amber. There was a strange droning noise as it passed overhead.
A triangle shaped object that had lights on that looked similar to a helicopter. There was one white, one green and one red light.
Two objects, with very bright lights. They were moving too slow to be aircraft.

Two distinctive lights, which were reddish in colour and were moving rapidly from 
South West to North.

There was a dark silhouette/figure/thing quite low in the sky. It seemed quite flat, 
and the edges seemed to curve downwards, slightly.

Fifty objects, each with a single orange light. They gathered, before ascending 
directly upwards.

A red, pipe like object. It was seen for about 10-15 seconds, very close to the 
plane. It then disappeared into the clouds.

Five lights were seen, that were followed by another fifteen lights, all moving in the 
same direction and extinguishing in the same area.

Six, strange lights which were yellow, but had orange in the centre. They were 
moving in a staggered formation across the sky, below the cloud base.
A cigar shaped object, with flashing lights. It was hovering.
There were eight small discs moving in a formation in the sky.

One bright, red object. It was quite large. It hovered for about five minutes, before 
heading East, gaining height and then vanishing.

A series of lights in a circle that had an inner circle. There were fifteen extra lights 
on the outside of the outer circle. They were moving clockwise, then anti-clockwise 
through the sky and then back again.

Eight, faint orange lights were flying in the sky. 
They suddenly disappeared when a plane was 
in it's view.

A long, thick, red streak shot across the sky. 
There was a silver ball of light attached to the 
front of it. It was rather large. The ball then got 
bigger and burst.

Two strange black discs in the sky, with 
orange lights on the side of them. They were 
hovering, and then started spinning around 
quite quickly.

A bright orange light appeared. Bigger than a 
helicopter or a plane. It zig-zagged and then 
flashed red and blue and moved in a circular 
motion. It then disappeared.

A jumbo jet sized object. The object was flat 
and round, with a blue rippled underside. It 
made no sound and then disappeared.

A bright circle shape was seen. It moved 
quickly and was quite erratic in the sky. It shot 
to the left over some houses and then 
disappeared.

Bright orange lights were seen, that were 
glowing bright, above trees in the distance. 
They were disappearing and reappearing 
erratically.

The witness saw a fast moving green object, 
whilst driving on the M6 Motorway.

Twenty five amber lights were seen leaving 
the Heathrow area. They were travelling West 
at 45 degrees, 200-300 knots.

A cork shaped object that glowed like an 
angel, flew up and over some trees.

Eight circular large yellow, bright solid lights 
moving East, South East. They were moving 
at high speed, low level.

Ninety orange lights were in a V or S shaped 
pattern. They were the size of footballs. They 
passed over the witness's house.

It resembled a white light, and was travelling 
at low speed. Was about two or three times 
bigger than Venus. Sometimes it looked like a 
spotlight, but there was no silhouette or 
shadow of an aircraft. There was no noise.

A UFO. Was quite far away and too high to be 
a plane.

Six orb shaped objects that were red and 
orange in colour. They initially formed a 'V' 
shape. They were floating around and then 
the central one zoomed off like the Captain 
Kirk Enterprise.

There were circles of white lights with a set of 
fire coming from inside each of them. They 
were like hang gliders, totally quiet. The last 
circle had  a red light. They were in a 
formation.

A stream of forty over-roundish lights. They 
were in separate formations, all in straight 
lines. They were a funny orange colour and 
were bright.

A large silent squadron of red/orange 
coloured flying craft. There must have been in 
excess of thirty. Maybe more. They were 
flying from West to East.

A very large inverted V shape of seven dull 
lights - greyish almost. There was no shell 
outline. It rotated slightly and then seemed to 
bounce. The lights then shot off individually at 
high speed.

A large, bright white object moving silently at 
fast speed in the sky at a very high altitude, 
heading from North East to South West. The 
colour then changed from white to red and 
then it stopped. It jumped to different parts of 
the sky.

There was a triangular object hovering a mile 
above the witness's house. It had a sort of 
pattern under it, like a sign. It also had three 
circular type of lights. There was a weird 
hovering sound. It then shot up in the sky and 
disappeared.

A bright spherical light was hovering above a 
house. The object slowly departed to the East 
and it spun and shifted at a rapid speed 
upwards in a Northerly direction, before 
disappearing.

A very high object came from out of space, 
travelling ten times the speed of sound. It was 
followed by a loud whooshing sound. The 
object was declining and was travelling far 
faster than any jet can go.

There was an orange object in the sky and it 
was the size of an aircraft. The object was 
about twenty miles away. It climbed into the 
sky very fast, and then disappeared.

There were two lights moving towards each 
other. They then merged, disappeared and re-
appeared, but were apart. The lights were 
seen to the South West.

A flicker of light that seemed to jump a 
considerable distance around the night sky. It 
had lights that seemed to scroll from one side 
to another.

A strange triangular shape in the sky, with the 
apex to the right. Metallic grey in colour, but 
the flat base end seemed to glow orange. 
Must have been at least fifteen feet long and 
ten feet wide.

A crest shaped object moving to the South 
East at the rear of the witness's property.

A very bright light, which had a long white tail. 
It then shot across the sky and the whole field 
was lit up. The light then began to break up.

An orange ball. The object was stationary for 
about five minutes and then shot up into the 
sky, and out of view. There was no sound.

There were fifteen UFOs/bright lights coming 
down from the Downs. They were travelling at 
very fast speeds.

An orange/red ball shot into the sky from a 
North Easterly direction. It travelled at terrific 
speed climbing all the time, then faded and 
disappeared. There was no noise.

There were fifteen lights moving across the 
sky about half a mile away. They were red 
and flickering. Then three lights formed a 
triangle shape. They were moving horizontally 
from left to right.

Six objects in two lines of three, one line 
above the other.  Emitted a very strong yellow 
orange light before disappearing in the 
distance to the west.

Four or five bright lights moving across sky 
north of Carlisle. Orange in colour. Retained a 
constant altitude then dissappeared from view 
heading westwards.

There was a large, bright orange light. There 
was no sound. It moved slowly initially and 
then there was rapid movement and it 
disappeared out of sight.

Ball of fire sitting in the sky. Changed colour 
from red to orange. Diamond shaped. Moved 
up & down and backwards in circles and then 
shot up and disappeared

Four or more moving bright solid orange lights. Followed by a further 
eight identical objects. Rose vertically over the side on the valley. 
Made no sound.

A V shaped formation similar to how birds fly of seven lights. Moved 
rapidly across the sky rotated slightly then the lights split up and 
vanished. Lights were size and brightness of stars. No noise and no 
visible trails in sky.
Five rather big orange things flew over the witness. He was terrified.

A green light with a white light on the outer rim. Flew over the hills 
and disappeared once it passed the motorway.

Strange white light, got smaller and turned green. Pulsated in 
brightness.

Same as the UFO seen over the House of Commons in February 
2008. Matches description The Sun gave.

A clearly defined, shiny silvery metallic cylinder with rounded ends. 
Estimated 50ft in length. Small protrusion on upper rear body. 
Object made no sound nor visible emissions.

A bright orange light travelling very fast from North to South east. 
Too large and bright to be a plane. In view for one minute then 
disappeared behind a cloud. Noticed no noise or tail.

Strange object in the sky. Bright orange in colour with intensity of 
fire. Like a huge hanglider.
Lights in the sky. Definitely not a plane. Very strange.

Witness saw a long light flashing like a laser. Sometimes there were 
two lights crossing over. This is the third time they have been seen 
over six weeks.

Two orange lights in the sky that hovered over the old hospital site. 
The lights were not together but were stationary. They made no 
noise. They then moved off in a southerly direction.

A bright light that went straight up in the sky above the A12 near 
Colchester.

A dome shaped orange ball of light. It suddenly took off from a field. 
It was organic like a jellyfish. Transparent, and you could see its 
internal workings. It departed swaying left to right and made a 
droning noise. 150-200ft in the air.

A ball of light with a few lights inside. It hovered over Gravesend for 
some 30 minutes. Too static for a helicopter.

Two strange lights behind the clouds that appeared to be playing 
with each other, pretending to crash into each other. Then they were 
joined by a third light that hovered underneath them, going back and 
forth.

Five bright orange lights in the sky. One was in the lead the other 
four in a loose rectangular formation. Disappeared behind trees then 
were seen in a line with long gaps between them. Heard no engine 
noise. Headed south for two miles before vanishing.

An object with a white and alternating red lights at an angle. Came 
from South East London towards Canary Wharf. It stopped in mid-air 
and an alternating sequence of red lights flashed at 180 degrees. 
Lights switched side instantly.

Object came in trajectory into back garden. It was like the upper part 
of an egg, glowing bright orange like hot steel. On bottom it had 
something like a root structure. It looked like it was having some 
trouble but righted itself, and gently flew off.

A ball of light in the clouds, moving slowly and falling apart. Had 
other white lights coming off it. Made no sound.

It was the flashing of a huge object with one normal and two green 
lights. It was flying low. Only saw it for four seconds than it vanished 
from sight.

Saw four spaceships that flew over the house into the sky. They had 
a bright light that faded and was then gone. They returned to the 
same spot they had come from.

Two lights above the cloud with beams of light coming out from 
them horizontally. Dotting about like two fireflies. The beams are 
coming from the lights, not the ground. Seen to the north. The lights 
are very round and flying in a small area.

One white light to the south east that flashes red, green and an off 
yellow at about 8-10000ft. Another across central London at 10-
15000ft with the same colours. Objects are identical and 3-4 miles 
apart on the approach path to Heathrow or London City.

Two orange lights over Hayle Estuary moving at the speed of a 
helicopter but had no aircraft navigation lights.
Bright orange object travelling west to east across the sky.

A big yellow glow in the sky to the south of Aberdeen. About 2500ft 
high but not aircraft landing lights.

Two sphere like objects orange/red in colour. The first object ran 
parallel to the witness, dropped then disappeared. The second 
object moved straight across the sky line then disappeared.

A long cylinder of gold light. It looked like a very bright shooting star. 
Observed it for 3 seconds.

The whole object was glowing like hot metal and there was no 
sound. It was travelling at the speed of a fighter or a satellite, from 
NW to SE. It looked to be flying quite low.

A group of very bright orange objects heading NW to SE at a 
consistent speed and low altitude. There was a group of 15 followed 
by groups of 2-3 and 3-4 over a five minute period. They made no 
noise.

Three bright lights heading in the same direction some 2 minutes 
apart. The 3rd light disintegrated and spilt up.

A massive orange thing. Going so fast it passed a plane going 
towards RAF Lyneham.

A bright orange ball of fire. It was quite high up in the sky over the 
house. It was changing colour and disappeared straight into the sky.

Very bright white light. Its trail followed it for half an hour heading 
towards Brough.

Looked like a squashed balloon and had no wings. Rounder at the 
front and pointed at the back. It had no lights at the front but 2-3 at 
the back, one red, one red and flashing and one white/green. 
Witness heard the noise first which grew louder.
Two parallel lights. Red or orange lights in the sky.

A very bright orange glow. Moved about the speed of an airliner, 
heading south to north.
A big ball of fire, like a star. It decreased in size over two minutes.

Several orange lights, same colour and brightness of street lights. 
Three were close together and the others were in a horizontal line.

A Light. Moved past very slowly then shot off at phenomenal speed. 
It was round but twice it changed into a cone shape. 300-400ft up.

Four glowing objects coming from southwest and then turned north. 
They were glowing duller and brighter, then disappeared.
Two yellow objects like giant sparklers heading North to South.

A orange ball in the sky, travelling very quickly then stopped and 
faded away.

An oval shaped glowing red object, in two dimensions. It spun in one 
direction then reversed and swung in the other.

Lights rising from the ground into the sky, much like debris from a 
fire. However lights were too intense to be a fire. Seen in the 
direction of the North Downs from Maidstone.

A bright flaming object, about a quarter of the size of the moon. It 
was like a special effect. It was silent and went from horizon to 
horizon, starting in the North.

Like a large black parachute with nothing suspended from it. It 
changed shape and gradually got smaller as it went into the 
distance. Observed for 10-20 minutes.

A long shaped vehicle with a red light at the front and two gold lights 
either side. Hovered above the house and then moved off to the 
right at tremendous speed before returning. It then drifted slowly 
away. It was louder than a plane or helicopter.

A large black ball with a light underneath. Travelling South over 
western Bury St Edmunds at 3000ft at 200 miles an hour.

A black spherical object 12m in diameter. It was 500ft up and 
travelling at 500 mph. It made no sound. It had a light on but 
switched it off when the witness shone a torch at it.

Two bright lights heading towards the city. Like a white octopus 
shaped kite. It was like they were propelled but travelling on their 
own.

A spherical object with a red flashing light underneath. It was 
stationary in the sky for 10 minutes and then just faded away. It had 
made no movement at all.

Single small white orb shortly joined by two others. Changed into a 
dull flat circular shape. They were hovering over Central London at 
15-20,000 ft but not blown by the wind. Objects disappeared but one 
reappeared for five minutes.

Looked like a star or satellite. Saw three within 20 minutes. Came 
from the south. Its speed increased and then slowed down. Finally 
headed east over the North Sea.

A bright green light that whizzed about the sky for an hour. It was 
very fast and a few planes got in its way.

Saw orange lights that looked like flames. They were heading South 
to North towards Preston. Police said it was the open rear of an 
aircraft undertaking parachute training.

Six very bright orange lights flying in formation passed by in 15 
minutes. Heading from Upper Norwood towards Crystal Palace.

Initially one then five pitch black hot air balloon shaped objects with 
continual flames underneath.

A large bright yellow object hovering in the sky. Too bright to be an 
aircraft and the wrong colour. It didn't move for ages and then 
disappeared in the blink of an eye.

A slow moving, silent, orangey/red light. Does not think it was a 
helicopter or aircraft. Flew at same height as a helicopter.

An ellipse shaped object the size of a commercial plane. It was on 
fire. It glowed bright orange. It moved South East to North and then 
returned and hovered for at least a minute. Moved further away at 
supersonic speed.

Very strange circular objects without definite shape. They stayed 
around for about five minutes. They were 8-9 of them.

Ten orange lights in a line with intermittent gaps. They made no 
sound and flew at helicopter height.
A very big red light moving slowly. It then faded away.

An orange light travelling from the south. It was followed by two 
more orange lights on the same path, then five more and then two 
more. They made no noise but were at the height of a helicopter.

A white object with a silver beam coming from it, over Pugneys 
Country Park. It looked square but changed shape as it moved 
about. Witness saw it through binoculars. An aircraft flew very close 
to it.

Three objects like fireballs falling to earth. They were glowing and 
orange. There was one large object and two smaller ones which 
converged together and rose into the atmosphere until they faded 
away.

A UFO. It was a "glowing ball of something or other". Definitely not a 
plane.

A bright circular amber light, the size of a 2p coin. It was moving 
very slowly in a straight line but once it flew over the witnesses 
house it accelerated away very very quickly into the distance. It 
made no noise and left no vapour trail.

Two clusters of bright lights. They were stationary for a while then 
the first group of 15 headed towards Woodbridge followed by the 
second cluster of 6-7 lights. They were very high up. They made no 
sound.

Two objects seen.  Photograph taken in June a week after the 
mystery hot air balloon search.

Saw a long greyish tube in the sky, when driving home along the 
A4031.
Eleven bright star like objects heading North East.

Bright orange lights. A single light followed by a group of three and 
then another single light. On a North East to South West track.

Different coloured pulsating lights. Police checked with Air Traffic 
Control who said they had nothing. Police suspect Chinese lanterns.

Initially two UFOs increasing to six. Bright orange. Last four were 
bigger and brighter than the first two.

A very bright orange circular shape. Got smaller as it moved away. 
Moving South West to South.

Black disc shaped objects hovering over crop circles near Barbury 
Castle. They cast shadows on the ground.

Two huge lights chasing each other like cat and mouse. It was 
broken cloud and the lights would never leave the clouds, just go to 
the edge. It looked like a strong light was coming from above the 
clouds. They both shot off to the North.

Nine objects like golden globes. They hovered for a bit and were 
joined by three others before shooting off.

Two orange balls of light travelling North in parallel to each other. 
Then a further ball of light was seen, heading North. The lights made 
no noise. They faded and then disappeared.

Two brown objects like balls of fire. Appeared to be in convoy 
heading towards Portreath.

A roundish glowing shape. Flying at a steady speed with no noise. It 
was a clear night. Filmed it but the camera died.

Seemed like a rather large disc or round in appearance. It was dark 
in colour but bounced sunlight off its surface. It was floating or 
bobbing up and down. Other aircraft were at the same altitude and 
could be heard, the object made no noise.

Eight alien aircraft seen just above helicopter height travelling SW 
to NE. There was a humming sound. They looked like they were 
"eyeing the place up".

12-15 objects. Not like normal fixed wing aircraft, more like bright 
orange lights. Moving West at indeterminate height. Objects entered 
cloud then turned around.

A red light followed by 7 others. They came from the West, flew 
overhead and disappeared. Definitely not aircraft.

Some 30 orange lights heading from Birmingham Airport towards 
Coleshill.

Three very bright orange lights. Fairly large and moving much faster 
than an aircrfat. They disappeared. Then two lights appeared from 
the South. The lights appeared co-ordinated. They were not aircraft.

A dormant blue light which changed colour many times over the 
hour it was witnessed. At first it was moving steadily and then it 
stopped in  mid air. Then started moving from left to right. A white 
beam could be seen shining down from it. It had red lights.

Two objects, one with a brighter light. The second one was behind it 
and had a dimmer light. No navigation lights. Not normal. Reluctant 
to say it was a UFO - perhaps it is a plane.

Five orange bright lights. Half a mile distance between each one. 
Took photos.

Fast, shiny discs. Lower and faster than a plane, not a plane or 
helicopter. Sphere, brilliant light.

Two sightings. First at 12:30 (bright light), second at 01:30 (flashing 
green).

Having a BBQ with some friends when saw an orange fireball about 
to crash two gardens away, but on checking it was now high in the 
sky about half mile away. 3-5 minutes later another object appeared 
then a third spherical object with a leg protruding.

Three bright orange lights, not flashing. Very big, high up, set 
equally apart. Reported it to RAF Northolt. Never saw anything like 
this before.

A UFO of orangey/red colour. It hovered and moved slightly in the 
direction of Stroud, then suddenly dropped downwards.

A bright, reddish light travelling W to E, below cloud level. It made 
no sound. It was moving in a straight line but too slow to be a 
meteorite. It had no navigation type lights.

10-12 bright orange objects, silent. Has a photo of them saved on 
his mobile.
Six yellow lights, stationary at first then moved off.

Four-five orange lights, fluctuating lights. Lives under flight path of 
Donnington airfield. Objects moved in a line. Lights faded. Returned 
10 minutes later.

Video footage in Cornwall near an Air Station (possibly Culdrose). 
Five minute sighting.

Large round object. Two planes flew round it. Could be something 
natural, such as an eclipse.

Light seen in sky also above this was a large round shape which 
looked rocky and was blue and pink in colour.

15 to 20 orange and red lights looked as though they were coming 
down to land but then went over head and 'went out'.

Big and very bright red/yellow/orange ball seen flying past backend 
of garden, just under cloud cover. Then went through cloud cover 
and lit cloud cover up.

Orange light, with 'some sort of flame' in the sky.  Moved from 
driveway to over the front of the house.  Then changed direction 
towards Wallgrave, direction changed again towards Reading then 
back in the direction of Wallgrave.

Three orange lights high in the sky over the sea.  There was an 
explosion and the centre light then dropped into the sea.  No sound 
heard from the lights.

Two bright orange lights, three to four minutes a part and no sound 
heard.  Lights then went into clouds.

First saw three orange objects. Forty minutes later, looking North 
saw an orange glowing object travelling slowly from SW to NE. It 
was at an angle to the ground of about 30-40 deg.

A bright orange light travelling in a straight line from Brighton 
Centre. Which then passed over the house.

Saw an orange, yellow object in the sky, with the shape similar to a 
hot air balloon.

Three bright orange lights and one dimmer one. Faded after being 
static.

Lights moving slowly. One light lead a group of five, with one light 
acting as tail ender.
17 UFO's above village. Red and green lights, no sound.

Orange point of light in the sky.  No haze or smoke visible around 
the object. Object was flickering slightly. Lasted about 60 secs.

Saw glider like objects in the sky. Flying around in an anti-clockwise 
direction.

Red object, looked like a clod, went over the roof and vanished. No 
noise/engine. Big orange colour lower than a plane. Gliding straight.

A bright white fire ball, size of a football flew into the kitchen and 
landed in a plastic carrier bag on the table, immediately disappeared 
but seemed to cause almost blinding white, sheet lightening.

Saw an orange light rising from the SE - looked like the tail from a 
rocket launch like when the shuttle goes up. Object then moved 
north before disappearing behind clouds. Happened three times over 
a period of 30 minutes. Third time bright flash.
Large bright light. Looked like a ball of fire or a hot air balloon.

Saw four strange orange lights in the sky following each other.  
Lights then just disappeared. Lights then seen again moving across 
the night sky.  Went inside and saw the same lights in a three prong 
triangle.

Six balloons of fire over Ullswater.  These UFOs moved at different 
speeds to each other and in different directions before burning out.
Unusual lights travelling silently from West to East.

Six to seven bright orange lights, moving down Wirral peninsula 
from Birkenhead to Ellesmere Port. No noise. Saw a second UFO 
five minutes later.
Eight orange, non-flashing lights, made no sound. Round shapes.

Four wavering lights, hovering, taken on a video camera and 
photographed.

Two yellow lights one above the other in the sky.  On arriving home 
five minutes later watched the lights disappear behind a narrow 
cloud bank.

Two sightings observed. One in summer 2008 single bright 
yellow/white light moving fast. Second sighting in daylight single 
bright yellow/white 2009 moving fast.

Saw 40 flickering orange lights from kitchen window. They made no 
noise and moved round to the side window of the house and 
disappeared behind a cloud.  Watched them for 5-10 minutes.
Two orbs, flickering lights, sliding across the sky.

Around eight yellow balls of light floating slowly in the night sky, 
slowly disappearing. Then one or two more would appear 500 to 800 
ft and follow same line of flight.  This happened for around two 
minutes.

Saw lights, moved into view from right to left, then stop and form a 
pattern before pulsing and fading out their bright orange lights.

Saw strange lights in the sky, in three's then one, then two's, then 
three's - Fifteen in all.

Red fire like ball . Glow was constant.  It was travelling at a constant 
speed West to East. Also watched it through binoculars and it 
appeared as a red circle with dots around the circle. In 10 o'clock 
position and watched it for 4-5 mins.

Saw eight orange single lights in the sky. Lights were very clear, 
single bright orange spot, which travelled at constant speed slowly 
higher into the eastern atmosphere. At first four lights in close 
proximity followed by four more with approx one minute.

Approx 10 orange lights flying over. First eight were going at a 
steady, slow rate, three of which merged into a triangle formation, 
separated then disappeared. Two others appeared about a minute or 
so travelling faster and disappeared at same area of sky.

Saw a vertical cylinder, silvery colour and underneath was a great 
bright yellow, fiery glow.  Watched the object for about 20 minutes.

Six bright orange lights - not flashing - silent. After a few minutes 
there was another one.

Saw a very bright light - looking south to right of the moon.  It was 
very large.  There were four or five bright lights.

Moving very fast SE to North and watched object for about 10 
seconds. Thought at first it was a star or a plane.

Brilliant and dazzling pure white horizontal ring of light.  It appeared 
to be perfectly still in the sky above the houses and was totally 
silent.  Object was hovering over the Belle Vue Crescent area.

Eight, orange UFOs, shone brightly, travelling at speed, low in the 
sky. Objects came across one by one with approx 20 seconds 
between them. They stopped over the reservoir changed direction at 
approx 90 deg angle towards Holmfirth.  No noise.

Five, really bright orange flame ball type objects seen flying across 
the sky, moving irregularly. One moving faster than a plane and one 
zig-zagged down towards the ground then reappeared after the other 
four had moved across the sky and had gone.

Thirty orange globes, in four waves, travelling at a constant speed. 
May have been lanterns of some kind but they would have been 1-2 
Metres in diameter.

Saw Orange flamed lights, in formation slowly and silently across 
the night sky.

White fixed wing object. Flying over a field, East Street, Charles 
Barn.  It was squared off with something behind it - no cockpit- silent 
not a glider.

Saw over the roof of their house orange/gold round circle about the 
size of a beach ball moving from behind the house going sideways 
across the roof  and down the road. As it moved down the road it 
change to a smaller light with no fiery glow.

Three blazing gold orbs in a diagonal line in the sky. No sound. 
Remained static approx one minute before moving slowly together 
to form a shape like Orion's Belt and then into a small triangle. Two 
lights further out faded and disappeared then third too.

Saw an object in sky like a fireball. It burnt pretty brightly, then would 
burn out a little then appear to burn brightly again before 
extinguishing about thirty seconds later.

Six to eight red lights moving across the skyline. Red spheres with a 
white centre. Eventually passed over the house from back to the 
front.

Saw an orange light in the distance.  It came nearer and eventually 
disappeared into cloud overhead but before it did saw other similar 
lights appearing in the distance. They were travelling at regular 
intervals.
